entries.meaning: A type of firework that uses a solid rocket engine to rise quickly into the sky where it emits a variety of effects such as stars, bangs, crackles, etc.

verbs.description: skyrocket (third-person singular simple present skyrockets, present participle skyrocketing, simple past and past participle skyrocketed)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To rise or increase suddenly and extremely; to shoot up; to surge or spike.
examples: The shortage caused prices to skyrocket.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To cause to increase suddenly and extremely.
examples: This is an area you'll have to work out in precise detail, as it's the area most likely to skyrocket your costs—or, without careful planning, leave you with thirsty guests.
